description: Overview over the most needed and many helpful metrics to manage and debug PostgreSQL servers.

panels.description: The CPU usage, rate over $rate_interval.
panels.title: CPU [$rate_interval]

panels.description: Shows the percentage of used storage on the most used mount.
panels.title: Max Used Storage

panels.description: Percentage of swap spaced used on system
panels.title: Swap

panels.description:
Age of oldest XID in percent of autovacuum_max_freeze_age (default: 200 M)

At 100%, tables will be frozen by autovacuum. Values over 100% indicate autovacuum is not keeping up.

targets.expr: max(sql_pg_stat_database{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', datname=~'$datname', col='freeze_age'}) / max(sql_settings{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='autovacuum_freeze_max_age'})

panels.title: Next Freeze

panels.description: The used connections in relation to the limit (reduced by superuser_reserved_connections).

targets.expr: sum(avg_over_time(sql_pg_stat_activity{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col="count"}[$rate_interval])) / (sum(sql_settings{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='max_connections'}) - sum(sql_settings{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='superuser_reserved_connections'}))

panels.title: Connections

panels.description:
Number of WAL files that still need to be archived.

Can grow under write load but should not increase over longer periods of time.
panels.title: WAL Files Ready

panels.description: The amount of WAL data that still needs to be archived.
panels.title: WAL Ready Growth [1h]

panels.description: Shows the rate/increase in failed archive actions.
panels.title: WAL Archive Fails [$rate_interval]

panels.description: Active WAL senders in relation to max_wal_senders.

targets.expr: count(sql_pg_stat_replication{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', pid!='0', col='flush_lag_bytes'})/ scalar(sql_settings{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='max_wal_senders'})

panels.title: WAL Senders

panels.description:
Shows the used prepared transactions in relation to max_prepared_transactions.

'N/A' if not used.

targets.expr: sum(sql_prepared_transactions{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='count', datname=~'$datname'}) / sum(sql_settings{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='max_prepared_transactions'})

panels.title: Prepared Transactions

panels.description:
Shows the maximum of send_lag_bytes, flush_lag_bytes, replay_lag_bytes over all connected streaming receivers.
This is not a sufficient way to monitor if a standby is up to date!
Can only give a hint if streaming is delayed.
panels.title: Max Replication Lag

panels.description: Modified memory that needs to be written back to permanent storage.
panels.title: Memory Dirty

panels.description:
Reads are shown above the 
zero line (>0) and writes are shown below (<0).
panels.title: Read/Write (IOPS) [$rate_interval] - $disk

panels.description:
Reads are shown above the 
zero line (>0) and writes are shown below (<0).
panels.title: Read/Write (bytes) [$rate_interval] - $disk

panels.description:
Reads are shown above the 
zero line (>0) and writes are shown below (<0).
panels.title: Read/Write Time [$rate_interval] - $disk

panels.description:
RX is shown above the 
zero line (>0) and TX is shown below (<0).
panels.title: Network Traffic [$rate_interval] - $interface

panels.description:
RX is shown above the 
zero line (>0) and TX is shown below (<0).
panels.title: Network Packets [$rate_interval] - $interface

targets.expr: sum by (state) (sql_pg_stat_activity{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='count', datname=~'$datname'})
sum by (datname) (sql_pg_stat_activity{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='count', datname=~'$datname'})
sum by (datname) (rate(sql_pg_stat_database{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='xact_commit', datname=~'$datname'}[$rate_interval]))
sum by (datname) (rate(sql_pg_stat_database{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='xact_rollback', datname=~'$datname'}[$rate_interval]))
topk($ntop_relations, sql_pg_stat_user_tables{job='$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster.*', col='n_live_tup', datname=~'$datname'})
topk($ntop_relations, sql_pg_stat_user_tables{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster.*', col='n_dead_tup', database=~'$datname'})
topk($ntop_relations, rate(sql_pg_stat_user_tables{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster.*', col='seq_scan', database=~'$datname'}[$rate_interval]))
topk($ntop_relations, rate(sql_pg_stat_user_tables{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster.*', col='idx_scan', datname=~'$datname'}[$rate_interval]))

panels.description:
Age of oldest XID in database

When reaching autovacuum_max_freeze_age (default: 200 M), tables will be frozen by autovacuum.
panels.title: Database Freeze Age - $datname

panels.description:
Number of WAL files that still need to be archived.

Can grow under write load but should not increase over longer periods of time.
panels.title: WAL Files Ready

panels.description: Successful and failed archive commands per minute.
panels.title: WAL Archiving per Minute [$rate_interval]

panels.description:
The amount of data a stream receiver like a standby server lags behind the master.

send_lag: Data that still needs to be send (should be small).

flush_lag: Data that was received but must be flushed to persistent storage (this data can be lost if the standby is terminated).

replay_lag: Data that still needs to be replayed by PostgreSQL on the standby (can lag behind during writes in asynchronous configurations).
panels.title: Replication Lag

panels.description: Statement average execution time

targets.expr: topk($ntop_relations, rate(sql_pg_stat_statements{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='total_time', datname=~'$datname'}[$rate_interval]) / ignoring(col) rate(sql_pg_stat_statements{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='calls', datname=~'$datname'}[$rate_interval]))

panels.title: Top $ntop_relations Statements by Average Execution Time [$rate_interval] - $datname

panels.description: Statement execution time per second

targets.expr: topk($ntop_relations, rate(sql_pg_stat_statements{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='total_time', datname=~'$datname'}[$rate_interval]))

panels.title: Top $ntop_relations Statements by Total Time [$rate_interval] - $datname

panels.description: Statements called per second

targets.expr: topk($ntop_relations, rate(sql_pg_stat_statements{job=~'$job', host=~'$host', sql_job=~'$cluster', col='calls', datname=~'$datname'}[$rate_interval]))

panels.title: Top $ntop_relations Statements by Calls [$rate_interval] - $datname

panels.description: Shows how the total time increase over the last $rate_interval.
panels.title: Statements by Total Time Increase [$rate_interval] - $datname

title: PostgreSQL Server Overview
